adjective.description: Botany. Designating or involving a structure resembling the stigma of a flower in form or function. rare.
Zoology. Designating a sensory seta arising from a pit in the integument of various mites. Chiefly in "pseudostigmatic organ".

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in American Naturalist. From pseudo- + stigmatic, in sense 2 after pseudostigma.
